perturbation.original_text: Consistent with Paragraph 15(c) of the Agreement, Licensee shall forfeit the Guarantee paid to date of ***** dollars
perturbation.changed_text: Licensee shall forfeit the Guarantee under conditions to be defined later.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the specific reference to Paragraph 15(c) and the Guarantee amount creates ambiguity. Later sections referencing the 'Guarantee Forfeiture Payment' will be unclear about its initial value or the conditions initially established, creating an internal contradiction.

perturbation.original_text: Fox hereby reserves the right to distribute all Wireless Products through Fox’s direct-to-consumer distribution channels, for which Fox shall retain a Distribution Fee as defined in Paragraph 4(a) of this Amendment.
perturbation.changed_text: Fox reserves the right to distribute Wireless Products through its distribution channels.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the phrase 'for which Fox shall retain a Distribution Fee as defined in Paragraph 4(a) of this Amendment,' we create an inconsistency. The right to distribute is maintained, but the method and specifics related to distribution fees are now undefined, even though the contract likely assumes it elsewhere.

perturbation.original_text: With the exception of Licensee’s Royalties payment obligations with respect to all Wireless Products released as of the date of this Amendment, and the obligations set forth in this Amendment, neither party shall have any further obligation under the Agreement, and all claims arising under the Agreement shall be mutually released.
perturbation.changed_text: Neither party shall have any further obligation under the Agreement, and all claims arising under the Agreement shall be mutually released.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the exception for 'Licensee’s Royalties payment obligations with respect to all Wireless Products released as of the date of this Amendment, and the obligations set forth in this Amendment' directly contradicts other sections that outline royalty payments. This creates significant uncertainty about ongoing financial responsibilities. Other section that references this one now have an exception that isn't true
